meanings.definition: To put away or store in a safe place.
meanings.sent1: I stow my toys in the toy box after playing.
meanings.sent2: Please stow your luggage in the overhead compartment.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stow his sandwich in his pocket, but it got squished.
meanings.sent4: She managed to stow away her secrets in a hidden drawer.
meanings.sent5: Remember to stow your valuables in a secure location.

meanings.definition: To pack or arrange in a compact way.
meanings.sent1: The sailor had to stow the cargo tightly to prevent it from shifting.
meanings.sent2: Let's stow the camping gear in the back of the car.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stow all his clothes in a tiny suitcase, but it wouldn't close.
meanings.sent4: She managed to stow away all her snacks in a small backpack.
meanings.sent5: It's important to stow your belongings efficiently when traveling.

meanings.definition: To secure or fasten in a particular place.
meanings.sent1: The captain instructed the crew to stow the anchor before setting sail.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to stow the tools in the toolbox after use.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stow the loose papers on his desk with a paperweight.
meanings.sent4: She managed to stow away the loose ends of the rope to keep it tidy.
meanings.sent5: Remember to stow the gate securely to keep it from swinging open.
